contentrichtext.text: {{nihongo|'''Amagi'''|甘木市|Amagi-shi}} was a [[cities of Japan|city in Japan]] located in [[Fukuoka Prefecture|Fukuoka]] [[Prefectures of Japan|Prefecture]] that merged along with the city of [[Haki, Fukuoka|Haki]] into their mutual neighbor [[Asakura, Fukuoka|Asakura]] on March 20, 2006. In 2003, the city had an estimated [[population]] of 42,449 with a [[population density]] of 253.90 persons per km<sup>2</sup>. Amagi contained 167.19 km<sup>2</sup> of land area. The city existed from April 1, 1954, and on March 20, 2006 Amagi was merged the towns of Asakura and [[Haki, Fukuoka|Haki]], both from [[Asakura District, Fukuoka|Asakura District]], to form the new city of [[Asakura, Fukuoka|Asakura]]. ==External links== * [http://www.city.asakura.lg.jp/ Asakura official website] {{ja icon}} {{Fukuoka}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Fukuoka Prefecture]] [[Category:Populated places disestablished in 2006]] [[Category:Populated places established in 1954]] {{Fukuoka-geo-stub}}
